channel.title: [Delta] Delete Walls at Higher Height [deletethatwall]
channel.description:
I'm wonderful with Website Development, but fail at Java. That's why I'm learning, so I have a simple question.. I have this set of codes (this is just one line) [code=java] deletethatwall(XXXX, YYYY); [/code]
This line works fine for deleting walls that are on height level 0 (ground level), how would I go about deleting walls on a higher height level, such as a two-story building. Thanks in advance for any help/suggestions. - The Web Guy

item.title: [Delta] Delete Walls at Higher Height [deletethatwall]
item.dc:creator: @Nebulae Nebulae
item.description:
@Nebulae wrote:

I see, then the height isn’t even taken into consideration. I assumed the -1 was to make the object invisible so the 0 was the height, but I forgot about orientation. Can you not just add int height as an attribute and then add an extra 0 after objectY?

public void deletethatwall(int objectX, int objectY, int height) {
    ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 0, 6951, -1, 0);
}

Maybe there’s more to adapt in the ReplaceObject method (if you post it please). I guess you can of course just do:

public void deletethatwall(int objectX, int objectY) {
    if (heightLevel = 0) {
        ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 0);
    } else if (heightLevel == 1) {
        //...
}

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Delete Walls at Higher Height [deletethatwall]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Nebulae, post:7, topic:459962”]Add

public void deleteThatWall2(int objectX, int objectY) {
    ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 1);
}

and use deleteThatWall2(####, ####); to delete objects with a height level of 1.

Edit: this is a simple way for you, you can of course edit the first method to take care for the height level once you show us some information. If you notice, the last int which was a 0 has changed to a 1, this is the height level.[/quote]

Actaully, in the RepalceObject2() method, that last number refers to the ObjectType integer. (0-22; depending on wall objects, wall decoration, diagonal walls, world objects, roofs, or floor decoration), Thanks for the input though.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Delete Walls at Higher Height [deletethatwall]
item.dc:creator: @Nebulae Nebulae
item.description:
@Nebulae wrote:

Add

public void deleteThatWall2(int objectX, int objectY) {
    ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 1);
}

and use deleteThatWall2(####, ####); to delete objects with a height level of 1.

Edit: this is a simple way for you, you can of course edit the first method to take care for the height level once you show us some information. If you notice, the last int which was a 0 has changed to a 1, this is the height level.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Delete Walls at Higher Height [deletethatwall]
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:5, topic:459962”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=562869.msg4103508#msg4103508 date=1347752329]
Could you post the method you use to spawn your objects? I am not all to familiar with Delta, but I can most likely solve this for you. The spawning objects method should give me something to reference to.
[/quote]

I actually don’t have one, checked the whole file.[/quote]
it should be “makeglobalobject” in your client class

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Delete Walls at Higher Height [deletethatwall]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:2, topic:459962”]find the deletethatwall method and add an int

should be something like int absX, int absY, int playerHeight

I could help more if you showed me your method for deleting global objects.[/quote]

Yeah sure, here you go.

public void deletethatwall(int objectX, int objectY) { ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 0); }

I’m mostly positive the correct int is ‘int heightLevel’

Read full topic
